TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WsdlExporter extends System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter

Docs.summary: Converts service, contract, and endpoint information into metadata documents.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter> class to transform <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> objects into metadata represented by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> objects.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter> is used in a three-step process.
1. Call the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportContract%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoint%2A>, or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoints%2A> method, passing the appropriate parameters.
2. Determine whether there are any export errors by checking the base <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.Errors%2A> property.
3. If there are no errors, use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.GetGeneratedMetadata%2A> to get a collection of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> objects or get more specific versions of the metadata using the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.GeneratedWsdlDocuments%2A> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.GeneratedXmlSchemas%2A> properties.
You can support exporting custom WSDL extensions by implementing the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> interface and custom policy assertions by implementing the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyExportExtension> interface. For details, see the documentation for those interfaces.
> [!NOTE] > The `WsdlExporter` can only be used to export metadata from `ContractDescription` instances that contain Common Language Runtime (CLR) type information, such as a `ContractDescription` instance created using the `ContractDescription.GetContract` method or created as part of the `ServiceDescription` for a `ServiceHost` instance. You cannot use the `WsdlExporter` to export metadata from `ContractDescription` instances imported from service metadata or constructed without type information.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoint%2A> method to generate a set of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> objects from the endpoints in a collection of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> objects called `myServiceEndpoints`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSet GetGeneratedMetadata() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an enumerable collection of generated objects.
Docs.returns: An enumerable collection of generated objects that represents the metadata generated as a result of calls to , , or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.GetGeneratedMetadata%2A> property to get a collection of all the metadata generated as a result of any number of calls to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportContract%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoint%2A>, or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoints%2A>.
It is recommended that you check the base <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.Errors%2A> property to determine whether any errors occurred before you retrieve the metadata.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoint%2A> method to generate a set of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> objects from the endpoints in a collection of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> objects called `myServiceEndpoints`.
